Boston.com
10

Missing Medford teen skier found alive at Maine resort

Nicholas Joy, 17, who had been missing on Sugarloaf since Sunday afternoon, was found alive this morning and is in good condition, officials said. (10:10 a.m.)

Globe announces top leadership changes

Boston Globe editor Brian McGrory has named Caleb Solomon as managing editor/digital, Chris Chinlund as managing editor/news, and Mark Morrow as senior deputy managing editor. (11:53 a.m.)

It was a neighborhood of streetcars, Woolworth's, and apartment buildings. See how Allston has transformed.

Large ocean storm will affect the region

Various models are predicting drastically different rain and snow totals from the approaching system, meteorologist David Epstein writes. (6:17 a.m.)

New high for Dow Jones industrial avg.

The Dow jumped nearly 100 points in early trading and hit 14,222, a record high. It’s on track to close today above its 2007 record close of 14,164. (11:13 a.m.)

Boston.com discussion forum

'Roadrunner' as state's official rock song? Some would say 'Dream On'

Fans of The Modern Lovers' "Roadrunner," a '70s ode to the joys of driving along Route 128 at night, are pushing for statewide song status. Others want Aerosmith's "Dream On." What do you think?
